dimensions: Warp x Weft (selvedge to selvedge): 155 x 76 cm (5 ft. 1 in. x 29 15/16 in.)
title: Apotheosis of Franklin
medium:
Medium: linen warp, cotton weft
Technique: copperplate printed on plain weave
description: Off-white cotton textile copperplate printed in red. The design, known as "American Independence" or "Apotheosis of Franklin" shows George Washington standing in a chariot drawn by leopards, and behind him a female figure holding a shield on which "American Independence 1776" is inscribed.  Benjamin Franklin is shown with a female figure carrying a liberty cap on a staff; above them on a scroll: "Where Liberty Dwells There is my Country."
name: Textile
